InstallationÂ¶

  • Make sure you have the latest version of Python 3 on your machine.

Note: It is highly recommended that you use a virtual environment while working with this project. More on Python virtual environments here.

  • Retrieve the latest version of the visualization directory from the annika branch of DSLEUTH.

  • In the visualization directory, run py -m pip install -r requirements.txt. This will install all of the necessary packages needed to run the tools.

Once the requirements have been installed, you can run the visualization tools directly from the command line. See other pages for specific instructions.
